title: Economy takes £20bn hit from business investment plunge since Brexit vote
text:
Uncertainty over Brexit has cut business investment by around 11pc over the three years following the referendum – equivalent to a £20bn hit to the UK economy, according to research.

The findings are published by the National Bureau of Economic Research (NBER) which also claims UK productivity fell by up to 5pc as a result of the Brexit process, partly as a result of senior management being distracted by the issue.
